item.title: The Millennial Obsession With Self-Care
item.description:
June 4, 2017 - Why are millennials so dedicated to self-care, while their parents are considerably more averse to the phenomenon?
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/04/531051473/the-millennial-obsession-with-self-care
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Michael Bloomberg Aim To Fight Noncommunicable Diseases Complicated By President's Pitch
item.description: June 4, 2017 - Michael Bloomberg and Dr. Kelly Henning talk to NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro about how the fight against noncommunicable diseases may be complicated by the president's plan to cut global health spending.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 4, 2017 - Michael Bloomberg and Dr. Kelly Henning talk to NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro about how the fight against noncommunicable diseases may be complicated by the president's plan to cut global health spending. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/04/531444415/michael-bloomberg-aim-to-fight-noncommunicable-diseases-complicated-by-president

item.title: Price Of Corn, A Kenyan Staple, Soars
item.description: June 4, 2017 - Food prices are soaring in Kenya and now a beloved staple, ugali, is out of reach for many working-class people. The government blames the high prices on drought, while some blame corruption.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 4, 2017 - Food prices are soaring in Kenya and now a beloved staple, ugali, is out of reach for many working-class people. The government blames the high prices on drought, while some blame corruption. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/04/531444392/price-of-corn-a-kenyan-staple-soars

item.title: Alan Alda's Experiment: Helping Scientists Learn To Talk To The Rest Of Us
item.description: June 4, 2017 - The actor's new book, If I Understood You, Would I Have This Look on My Face?, is all about communication — and miscommunication — between doctors, scientists and civilians.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 4, 2017 - The actor's new book, If I Understood You, Would I Have This Look on My Face?, is all about communication — and miscommunication — between doctors, scientists and civilians. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/04/531271710/alan-aldas-experiment-helping-scientists-learn-to-talk-to-the-rest-of-us

item.title: A Different Kind Of Pickup: Prostitutes Turn To Driving Motorbike Taxis
item.description: June 4, 2017 - A group of 18 prostitutes and 17 unemployed women in Sierra Leone were trained to drive motorcycle taxis. The money was great. But now there's a big catch.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 4, 2017 - A group of 18 prostitutes and 17 unemployed women in Sierra Leone were trained to drive motorcycle taxis. The money was great. But now there's a big catch. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/04/528509723/a-different-kind-of-pickup-prostitutes-turn-to-driving-motorbike-taxis

item.title: Our Last Year Together: What My Camera Captured As My Parents Died Of Cancer
item.description: June 4, 2017 - Photographer Nancy Borowick captured her parents' deep love and joy in life, even as they endured treatment in their 50s for the cancers they knew would soon kill them.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 4, 2017 - Photographer Nancy Borowick captured her parents' deep love and joy in life, even as they endured treatment in their 50s for the cancers they knew would soon kill them. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/04/527574473/our-last-year-together-what-my-camera-captured-as-my-parents-died-of-cancer

item.title: A Botched Vaccine Campaign For Measles Killed 15 Children in South Sudan
item.description: June 2, 2017 - The children, all under age 5, died of severe sepsis and toxicity. How could something like this have happened?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - The children, all under age 5, died of severe sepsis and toxicity. How could something like this have happened? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/02/531268150/a-botched-vaccine-campaign-for-measles-killed-15-children-in-south-sudan

item.title: The Soprano And The Scientist: A Conversation About Music And Medicine
item.description: June 2, 2017 - NIH Director Francis Collins and Renée Fleming, who is Artistic Advisor at Large for the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., discuss music and medicine. They also sing a duet.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - NIH Director Francis Collins and Renée Fleming, who is Artistic Advisor at Large for the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., discuss music and medicine. They also sing a duet. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/02/530879198/the-soprano-and-the-scientist-a-conversation-about-music-and-medicine

item.title: Many COPD Patients Struggle To Pay For Each Breath
item.description: June 2, 2017 - One in 9 Medicare enrollees have chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and many of them can't afford the inhalers that keep them out of the emergency room.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - One in 9 Medicare enrollees have chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, and many of them can't afford the inhalers that keep them out of the emergency room. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/02/529759280/many-copd-patients-struggle-to-pay-for-each-breath

item.title: Do Carrots Really Help Your Vision?
item.description: June 2, 2017 - The orange vegetable helps us see — but that's different from improving our vision. That said, carrots are part of a diet designed for eye health.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 2, 2017 - The orange vegetable helps us see — but that's different from improving our vision. That said, carrots are part of a diet designed for eye health. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/06/02/529142959/do-carrots-really-help-your-vision

item.title: The Role Of Yoga In Healing Trauma
item.description:
June 2, 2017 - So-called 'trauma-aware yoga' has mind and body benefits, says Georgetown research.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/06/02/527570310/the-role-of-yoga-in-healing-trauma
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Using Music And Rhythm To Help Kids With Grammar And Language
item.description: June 1, 2017 - Researchers at Vanderbilt University Medical Center are studying how music and rhythm activities could help children who struggle with grammar and language development.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - Researchers at Vanderbilt University Medical Center are studying how music and rhythm activities could help children who struggle with grammar and language development. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/01/530723046/using-music-and-rhythm-to-help-kids-with-grammar-and-language

item.title: 3.6 Percent Of Americans Found To Have Food Allergies Or Intolerances
item.description: June 1, 2017 - A new study by researchers at Brigham and Women's Hospital finds that women and people of Asian descent are the most at risk and that shellfish is the most common allergen.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - A new study by researchers at Brigham and Women's Hospital finds that women and people of Asian descent are the most at risk and that shellfish is the most common allergen. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/01/531088344/3-6-percent-of-americans-found-to-have-food-allergies-or-intolerances

item.title: Cracking The Code That Lets The Brain ID Any Face, Fast
item.description: June 1, 2017 - People and other primates have an amazing ability to instantly recognize faces. Scientists at Caltech found that we do that by having 205 specialized brain cells divvy up the task.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - People and other primates have an amazing ability to instantly recognize faces. Scientists at Caltech found that we do that by having 205 specialized brain cells divvy up the task. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/01/530925382/cracking-the-code-that-lets-the-brain-id-any-face-fast

item.title: How Restricting Abortion Access Affects Rural America
item.description: June 1, 2017 - In many towns, the only access to care comes from clinics that also offer abortions. As these facilities continue to be shut down, how can women's healthcare needs be addressed?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 1, 2017 - In many towns, the only access to care comes from clinics that also offer abortions. As these facilities continue to be shut down, how can women's healthcare needs be addressed? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-06-01/how-restricting-abortion-access-affects-rural-america
